verses.verse: Now it came <WH1961> about in those <WH1992> days, <WH3117> when there <WH369> was no <WH369> king <WH4428> in Israel, <WH3478> that there was a certain <WH376> Levite <WH3881> staying <WH1481> in the remote <WH3411> part <WH3411> of the hill <WH2022> country <WH2022> of Ephraim, <WH669> who took <WH3947> a concubine <WH6370> for himself from Bethlehem <WH1035> in Judah. <WH3063>

But his concubine <WH6370> played <WH2181> the harlot <WH2181> against <WH5921> him, and she went <WH1980> away from him to her father's house <WH1004> in Bethlehem <WH1035> in Judah, <WH3063> and was there <WH8033> for a period <WH3117> of four <WH702> months. <WH2320>

Then her husband <WH376> arose <WH6965> and went <WH1980> after <WH310> her to speak <WH1696> tenderly <WH3820> to her in order to bring <WH7725> her back, <WH7725> taking with him his servant <WH5288> and a pair <WH6776> of donkeys. <WH2543> So she brought <WH935> him into her father's house, <WH1> and when the girl's father saw <WH1004> him, he was glad <WH7200> to meet <WH8055> him.

And his father-in-law, the girl's father, detained <WH1> him; and he remained <WH2388> with him three <WH3427> days. <WH7969> So they ate <WH3117> and drank <WH398> and lodged <WH8354> there. <WH3885>

Now it came <WH1961> about on the fourth <WH7243> day <WH3117> that they got <WH7925> up early <WH7925> in the morning, <WH1242> and he prepared <WH6965> to go; <WH1980> and the girl's father said <WH1> to his son-in-law, "Sustain <WH559> yourself <WH5582> with a piece <WH3820> of bread, <WH6595> and afterward <WH3899> you may go. <WH310>"

So both <WH8147> of them sat <WH3427> down <WH3427> and ate <WH398> and drank <WH8354> together; <WH9191> and the girl's father said <WH1> to the man, <WH559> "Please <WH376> be willing <WH4994> to spend <WH2974> the night, <WH3885> and let your heart <WH3885> be merry. <WH3820>"
Then the man <WH376> arose <WH6965> to go, <WH1980> but his father-in-law urged <WH6484> him so that he spent <WH3885> the night <WH3885> there <WH8033> again. <WH7725>

And on the fifth <WH2549> day <WH3117> he arose <WH7925> to go <WH1980> early <WH7925> in the morning, <WH1242> and the girl's father said, <WH1> "Please <WH559> sustain <WH4994> yourself, <WH5582> and wait <WH3824> until <WH4102> afternoon <WH5704> <WH5186>"; so both <WH3117> of them ate. <WH8147>

When the man <WH376> arose <WH6965> to go <WH1980> along with his concubine <WH6370> and servant, <WH5288> his father-in-law, the girl's father, said <WH1> to him, "Behold <WH559> now, <WH2009> the day <WH4994> has drawn <WH3117> to a close; <WH7503> please <WH6150> spend <WH4994> the night. <WH3885> Lo, <WH3885> the day <WH2009> is coming <WH3117> to an end; <WH2583> spend <WH2583> the night <WH3885> here <WH3885> that your heart <WH6311> may be merry. <WH3824> Then tomorrow <WH3190> you may arise <WH4279> early <WH7925> for your journey <WH7925> so that you may go <WH1870> home. <WH1980>"

But the man <WH376> was not willing <WH14> to spend <WH3885> the night, <WH3885> so he arose <WH6965> and departed <WH1980> and came <WH935> to [a place] opposite <WH5227> Jebus <WH2982> (that is, Jerusalem <WH3389>). And there were with him a pair <WH6776> of saddled <WH2280> donkeys; <WH2543> his concubine <WH6370> also was with him.

When they [were] near <WH5973> Jebus, <WH2982> the day <WH3117> was almost <WH3966> gone; <WH7286> and the servant <WH5288> said <WH559> to his master, <WH113> "Please <WH4994> come, <WH1980> and let us turn <WH5493> aside <WH5493> into this <WH2088> city <WH5892> of the Jebusites <WH2983> and spend <WH3885> the night <WH3885> in it."

However, his master <WH113> said <WH559> to him, "We will not turn <WH5493> aside <WH5493> into the city <WH5892> of foreigners <WH5237> who <WH834> are not of the sons <WH1121> of Israel; <WH3478> but we will go <WH5674> on as far <WH5704> as Gibeah. <WH1390>"

And he said <WH559> to his servant, <WH5288> "Come <WH1980> and let us approach <WH7126> one <WH259> of these places; <WH4725> and we will spend <WH3885> the night <WH3885> in Gibeah <WH1390> or <WH176> Ramah. <WH7414>"
So they passed <WH5674> along <WH5674> and went <WH1980> their way, and the sun <WH8121> set <WH935> on them near <WH681> Gibeah <WH1390> which <WH834> belongs to Benjamin. <WH1144>

And they turned <WH5493> aside <WH5493> there <WH8033> in order to enter <WH935> [and] lodge <WH3885> in Gibeah. <WH1390> When they entered, <WH935> they sat <WH3427> down <WH3427> in the open <WH7339> square <WH7339> of the city, <WH5892> for no <WH369> one <WH376> took <WH622> them into [his] house <WH1004> to spend <WH3885> the night. <WH3885>

Then behold, <WH2009> an old <WH2205> man <WH376> was coming <WH935> out of the field <WH7704> from his work <WH4639> at evening. <WH6153> Now the man <WH376> was from the hill <WH2022> country <WH2022> of Ephraim, <WH669> and he was staying <WH1481> in Gibeah, <WH1390> but the men <WH376> of the place <WH4725> were Benjamites. <WH1145>

And he lifted <WH5375> up his eyes <WH5869> and saw <WH7200> the traveler <WH376> <WH732> in the open <WH7339> square <WH7339> of the city; <WH5892> and the old <WH2205> man <WH376> said, <WH559> "Where <WH575> are you going, <WH1980> and where <WH370> do you come <WH935> from?"

And he said <WH559> to him, "We are passing <WH5674> from Bethlehem <WH1035> in Judah <WH3063> to the remote <WH3411> part <WH3411> of the hill <WH2022> country <WH2022> of Ephraim, <WH669> [for] I am from there, <WH8033> and I went <WH1980> to Bethlehem <WH1035> in Judah. <WH3063> But I am [now] going <WH1980> to my house, <WH1004> and no <WH369> man <WH376> will take <WH622> me into his house. <WH1004>

"Yet there <WH3426> is both <WH1571> straw <WH8401> and fodder <WH4554> for our donkeys, <WH2543> and also <WH1571> bread <WH3899> and wine <WH3196> for me, your maidservant, <WH519> and the young <WH5288> man <WH5288> who is with your servants; <WH5650> there <WH369> is no <WH369> lack <WH4270> of anything. <WH3605> <WH1697>"

And the old <WH2205> man <WH376> said, <WH559> "Peace <WH7965> to you. Only <WH7534> let me [take care of] all <WH3605> your needs; <WH4270> however, <WH7534> do not spend <WH3885> the night <WH3885> in the open <WH7339> square. <WH7339>"
So he took <WH935> him into his house <WH1004> and gave <WH9054> the donkeys <WH2543> fodder, <WH9054> and they washed <WH7364> their feet <WH7272> and ate <WH398> and drank. <WH8354>

While they were making <WH3190> <WH3820> merry, <WH3190> <WH3820> behold, <WH2009> the men <WH376> of the city, <WH5892> certain <WH376> worthless <WH1100> fellows, <WH1121> surrounded <WH5437> the house, <WH1004> pounding <WH1849> the door; <WH1817> and they spoke <WH559> to the owner <WH1167> of the house, <WH1004> the old <WH2205> man, <WH376> saying, <WH559> "Bring <WH3318> out the man <WH376> who <WH834> came <WH935> into your house <WH1004> that we may have <WH3045> relations <WH3045> with him."

Then the man, <WH376> the owner <WH1167> of the house, <WH1004> went <WH3318> out to them and said <WH559> to them, "No, <WH408> my fellows, <WH251> please <WH4994> do not act <WH7489> so wickedly; <WH7489> since <WH310> <WH834> this <WH2088> man <WH376> has come <WH935> into my house, <WH1004> do not commit <WH6213> this <WH2088> act <WH5039> of folly. <WH5039>

"Here <WH2009> is my virgin <WH1330> daughter <WH1323> and his concubine. <WH6370> Please <WH4994> let me bring <WH3318> them out that you may ravish <WH6031> them and do <WH6213> to them whatever you wish. <WH2896> <WH5869> But do not commit <WH6213> such <WH2088> an act <WH1697> of folly <WH5039> against this <WH2088> man. <WH376>"

But the men <WH376> would <WH14> not listen <WH8085> to him, so the man <WH376> seized <WH2388> his concubine <WH6370> and brought <WH3318> [her] out to them. And they raped <WH3045> her and abused <WH9412> her all <WH3605> night <WH3915> until <WH5704> morning, <WH1242> then let <WH7971> her go <WH7971> at the approach <WH5927> of dawn. <WH7837>

As the day <WH1242> began to dawn, <WH6437> <WH1242> the woman <WH802> came <WH935> and fell <WH5307> down <WH5307> at the doorway <WH6607> of the man's house <WH1004> where <WH834> <WH8033> her master <WH113> was, until <WH5704> [full] daylight. <WH216>

When her master <WH113> arose <WH6965> in the morning <WH1242> and opened <WH6605> the doors <WH1817> of the house <WH1004> and went <WH3318> out to go <WH1980> on his way, <WH1870> then behold, <WH2009> his concubine <WH6370> was lying <WH5307> at the doorway <WH6607> of the house, <WH1004> with her hands <WH3027> on the threshold. <WH5592>

And he said <WH559> to her, "Get <WH6965> up and let us go, <WH1980>" but there <WH369> was no <WH369> answer. <WH6030> Then he placed <WH3947> her on the donkey; <WH2543> and the man <WH376> arose <WH6965> and went <WH1980> to his home. <WH4725>

When he entered <WH935> his house, <WH1004> he took <WH3947> a knife <WH3979> and laid <WH2388> hold <WH2388> of his concubine <WH6370> and cut <WH5408> her in twelve <WH8147> <WH6240> pieces, <WH5409> limb by limb, <WH6106> and sent <WH7971> her throughout <WH3605> the territory <WH1366> of Israel. <WH3478>

And it came <WH1961> about that all <WH3605> who saw <WH7200> [it] said, <WH559> "Nothing <WH3808> like this <WH2088> has [ever] happened <WH1961> or been seen <WH7200> from the day <WH3117> when the sons <WH1121> of Israel <WH3478> came <WH5927> up from the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714> to this <WH2088> day. <WH3117> Consider <WH7760> it, take <WH5779> counsel <WH5779> and speak <WH1696> up!"
